title.narrative: PG Second Mining Sector Inst Strengthening TA

description.narrative: The project development objective is to improve the benefits from Extractive Industries (EI) to the national budget and to mining affected communities and to mitigate mining's health and safety risks for ASM miners. This will be achieved through improving effectiveness of key EI sector institutions, supporting EI communities to be better able to monitor the delivery of community programs and services, empowering disadvantaged groups including women and youth in extractive industries affected areas, and improving accountability of the sector and for management and use of mining-related revenues. The primary target groups are the institutions involved in the mining sector, the communities in the vicinity of both large-scale and artisanal/small scale mining operations and the recipients and managers of mining benefits streams.

title.narrative: New mining legislation developed and adopted
Number of ASM miners using mercury management or zero mercury technologies
New mining sector policies developed, including mine closure, offshore mining and mining safety
Number of communities where MRA provides reports on benefits streams and discusses these with communities
Mining community representatives participate in preparation of Local Level Mining Community Development Plans

Number of community groups participating in community planning

actual.value: Target of 3 at each mine being met

title.narrative: Increased Tax Assessments from IRC audits

actual.value: The team comprising sixteen officers has started the audit of two large resource corporations, netting PNGK 57 million (aboutUS$28million) in payments for tax shortfalls

title.narrative: Number of IRC tax audits conducted
Exploration and Mining license processing time is reduced

actual.value: Data to re-confirmed ahead of next mission in October 2013
